name: elusively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is difficult to describe, find, achieve, or remember: He remained elusively in the background all evening. "Oh, it just depends if it's a good day or a bad day," she said elusively. See
elusive
More examplesFewer examplesIn his paintings the focus is often far back in the picture, where a river or a gorge in the hills twists elusively out of sight.Once more he had elusively slipped away.She spoke elusively and vaguely, so it was hard to recall anything she'd said. These items remain elusively rare in the shops.
